titleStmt.title: Hiram Dugan to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6602

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Hon Tho's. E. Bramblette
Governor of Ky,

Your Petitioner Hiram Dugan would respectfully Represent that at theMarch Term 1865 of the Pulaski Circuit Court he was fined $20 for Retailing Liquor -- He states that he had just moved into his hotel and had sold Liquor at his bar one day before obtaining his License -- and for so doing he was indicted and fined --. He says he had no intention to violated, and his only fault was that in the hurry incident to moving he neglected to obtain his License -- He therefore respectfully asks that sd fine be remitted --
The undersigned concur in the prayer of the Petition

Thos Z Morrow
James S. Burk
G. J. Vaught
C B Bacheller
M T. E. Ingram
W. A. Sallee

Pulaski Cir Ct
vs
Hiram Dugan
$20,
29 June/65
Remit
